summary: Frontex, formally known as the European Border and Coast Guard Agency, is an essential EU institution established to enhance the management of the EU's external borders. Its legal framework is grounded in Regulation (EU) 2016/1624, which empowers Frontex to facilitate operational cooperation among member states, provide technical assistance, and ensure the effective implementation of EU border management policies. The agency plays a pivotal role in addressing challenges related to migration and security, while also promoting the fundamental rights of individuals. Frontex's activities are crucial for maintaining the integrity of the Schengen Area and ensuring compliance with EU legal standards.
